metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46877 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
By confusing the browser, the fullscreen notification could have beendelayed or suppressed, resulting in potential user confusion or spoofingattacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46877` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
